snippet: A four-judge panel upheld a lower-court ruling that SungEun Grace Lee was mentally competent to make decisions about her own care, handing a defeat to her parents.
abstract: Appeals court panel upholds lower-court ruling that brain cancer patient SungEun Grace Lee is mentally competent to make decisions about her care, handing a defeat to her parents, who argue that her medicated state makes her incompetent; doctors at North Shore University Hospital have testified that she has clearly expressed a desire to be removed from life support, but her deeply religious parents argue that such a decision would be tantamount to suicide.
lead_paragraph: A four-judge panel upheld a lower-court ruling that SungEun Grace Lee was mentally competent to make decisions about her own care, handing a defeat to her parents.

headline.seo: Court Backs SungEun Grace Lee, but Doubts About Her Wishes Arise
headline.main: Court Backs a Terminally Ill Woman, but Doubts About Her Wishes Arise
headline.print_headline: Court Backs a Terminally Ill Woman, but Doubts About Her Wishes Arise
